VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Delivery Speed relative to the peak of Return Policies in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Delivery Speed is to the {left} of the peak of Return Policies.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Product Quality show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Product Quality shows a {Periodic fluctuation}.

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Personalization} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =77.8?
EVJ.A: At X =77.8,the label with the highest density is {Delivery Speed}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 31? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Personalization}'s peak at {57},{Product Quality}'s peak at {84},{Return Policies}'s peak at {84},{Loyalty Programs}'s peak at {79},{Product Range}'s peak at {80},{Delivery Speed}'s peak at {78}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 39? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Product Range or Loyalty Programs?
NC.A: {Product Range} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Delivery Speed or Product Range?
NC.A: {Product Range} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {6} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Personalization}
